oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Foggy day at Vung Chua Mountain base

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: View of Vung Chua Mountain on a foggy day. The base and array of signals are pictured on the left. Two soldiers can be seen sitting on top of a concrete bunker in the center of the frame.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military facilities; Mountains; Signal stations; Military personnel; Soldiers; Forts & fortifications; Bunkers
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. Chris began his service as a replacement after the as a replacement after the Tet Offensive and patrolled the Iron Triangle during his 1st tour. He briefly returned to the US in 1968 and was stationed at the armory in Fort Bragg. He returned to Vietnam as an MP in 1969.
